__Topic 1: Basic Tools of Mathematical Economics__  

[Lecture notes]()
Some functions relevant for economics and their shapes. 
```{r rational-function}
x = seq(-10,10, length.out = 25)
y = (x^2 + 3)/(5*x + 7)
plot(x,y, type = "l", col = "red")
# when we obtain more values between -10 and 10,
# the jump becomes smoother
x = seq(-10,10, length.out = 2500)
y = (x^2 + 3)/(5*x + 7)
plot(x,y, type = "l")
```

```{r Cost-functions}
# total cost function:
L = seq(0,10, length.out = 2500)
TC = 200 + 178 *L 
plot(L, TC, type = "l")
AFC = 2000/L
plot(L, AFC, type = "l")
TVC = 178 * L
plot(L, TVC, type = "l")
AVC = rep(178, 2500)
plot(L, AVC, type = "l", col = "blue")
```
